H0.text: Mechanical energy is produced when two objects move together.

H1.text: Internal energy is produced when two objects move together.

H2.text: Kinetic energy is the type of energy produced when two objects move together.

H3.text: Fluid is the type of energy produced when two objects move together.

A4.text: Kinetic energy can be passed from one object to another. In the game of billiards, the player imposes kinetic energy on the cue ball by striking it with the cue stick. If the cue ball collides with another ball, it slows down dramatically, and the ball it hit accelerates as the kinetic energy is passed on to it.

A5.text: When a person throws a ball, the person does work on it to give it speed as it leaves the hand. The moving ball can then hit something and push it, doing work on what it hits.
